timeline.bodyText: Instead of modifying the provided String shouldn't we create a new one in this method?
timeline.author: jamesrichard91

+package com.synopsys.integration.azure.boards.common.http;
+
+import static com.synopsys.integration.azure.boards.common.http.AzureHttpService.AZURE_API_VERSION_QUERY_PARAM_NAME;
+
+import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils;
+
+public class AzureApiVersionAppender {
+    public String appendApiVersion(String spec, String apiVersion) {
+        char queryParamSeparator = '?';
+        if (StringUtils.contains(spec, queryParamSeparator)) {
+            queryParamSeparator = '&';
+        }
+        spec += queryParamSeparator;

replies.bodyText: Given that string are immutable, that IS what occurs anyway. But I can make it more explict.
replies.author: ekerwin

timeline.bodyText:
Probably the latter. Each service that needs to append a version should have an AzureApiVersionAppender. The version constants should probably end up in AzureApiVersionAppender as well.
The original code here was a misunderstanding of the Azure API (thinking that all endpoints we would use would use the same API version).
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: I injected the appender and added some utility methods for appending specific versions.
replies.author: ekerwin

timeline.bodyText: Is this not thrown? why are we removing it?
timeline.author: jamesrichard91

timeline.bodyText: Looks like this was supposed to be based on: API_SPEC_ORGANIZATION_WORKITEMS_INDIVIDUAL
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: I used API_SPEC_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT_WORKITEMS_INDIVIDUAL because the spec template looked to be the same for getting the WorkItemDeleted. I realized it matched the ...WORKITEMS_INDIVIDUAL so I reused it in this spot
replies.author: ChomickiM

replies.bodyText: Right, but that would not have worked right?
replies.author: gkillough
gkillough

timeline.message: adding some utility methods to appender
